</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of June&nbsp;30, 2015, the last business day of the registrant&#146;s most recently completed second fiscal quarter, there were 18,555,527
	shares of the registrant&#146;s common stock outstanding, and the aggregate market value of such shares held by non-affiliates of the registrant (based upon the closing sale price of such shares on the NASDAQ Global Select Market on June&nbsp;30,
	2015) was approximately
<I>
</I>
	$133,228,684. Shares of the registrant&#146;s common stock held by each executive officer and director and by each entity that owns 5% or more of the registrant&#146;s outstanding common stock have been excluded
	because such persons may be deemed to be affiliates.&nbsp;This determination of affiliate status is not necessarily a conclusive determination for any other purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	17,264,986 shares of common stock were issued and outstanding as of March&nbsp;10, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Documents Incorporated by Reference
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Certain sections of the registrant&#146;s definitive proxy statement relating to its 2016 Annual Stockholders&#146; Meeting to be held on June&nbsp;14, 2016
	are incorporated by reference into Part III of this Annual Report on Form 10-K.&nbsp;The Company intends to file its proxy statement within 120 days after the end of its fiscal year end to which this report relates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:3.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	PART I
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<A NAME="D68635D10K_HTM_TOC68635_1">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;1:
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Business
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Annual Report on Form 10-K contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of
	Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#147;Securities Act&#148;) and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;). These statements include, among other things, statements
	concerning our future operations, financial condition and prospects, and business strategies. The words &#147;believe&#148;, &#147;expect&#148;, &#147;anticipate&#148; and other similar expressions generally identify forward-looking statements.
	Investors in our common stock are cautioned not to place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements. These forward-looking statements are subject to substantial risks and uncertainties that could cause our future business, financial
	condition, or results of operations to differ materially from the historical results or currently anticipated results. Investors should carefully review the information contained in Item 1A. Risk Factors and elsewhere in, or incorporated by
	reference into, this Annual Report on Form 10-K. Other factors not currently anticipated may also materially and adversely affect our results of operations, cash flows and financial position. There can be no assurance that future results will meet
	expectations. While we believe that the forward-looking statements in this Annual Report on Form 10-K are reasonable, investors should not place undue reliance on any forward-looking statements. In addition, these statements speak only as of the
	date made. We do not undertake, and expressly disclaim any obligation to update or alter any statements whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise, except as may be required by applicable law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	PCTEL, Inc. (&#147;PCTEL&#148;, the
	&#147;Company&#148;, &#147;we&#148;, &#147;ours&#148;, and &#147;us&#148;) delivers
<B>
	P
</B>
	erformance
<B>
	C
</B>
	ritical
<B>
	Tel
</B>
	ecom solutions. Our RF Solutions&#153; segment develops and provides test equipment, software and engineering services
	for wireless networks. The industry relies upon PCTEL to benchmark network performance, analyze trends, and optimize wireless networks. Our Connected Solutions&#153; segment designs and delivers performance critical antennas and site solutions for
	wireless networks globally. Our antennas support evolving wireless standards for cellular, private, and broadband networks. PCTEL antennas and site solutions support networks worldwide, including Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition
	(&#147;SCADA&#148;) for oil, gas and utilities, fleet management, industrial operations, healthcare, small cell and network timing deployment, defense, public safety, education, and broadband access.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	PCTEL was incorporated in California in 1994 and reincorporated in Delaware in 1998.&nbsp;Our principal executive offices are located at 471 Brighton Drive,
	Bloomingdale, Illinois 60108.&nbsp;Our telephone number at that address is (630) 372-6800 and our website is
<I>
	www.pctel.com
</I>
	.&nbsp;The information within, or that can be accessed through, our website, is not part of this report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Segment Reporting
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	PCTEL operates in two segments for
	reporting purposes, Connected Solutions and RF Solutions.&nbsp;Our chief operating decision maker uses the profit and loss results through operating profit and identified assets for the Connected Solutions and RF Solutions segments to make operating
	decisions.&nbsp;Each segment has its own segment manager as well as its own engineering, sales and marketing, and operational general and administrative functions.&nbsp;All of our accounting and finance, human resources, IT and legal functions are
	provided on a centralized basis through the corporate function. We manage the balance sheet and cash flows centrally at the corporate level, with the exception of trade accounts receivable and inventory which is managed at the segment level. Each of
	the segment managers reports to and maintains regular contact with the chief operating decision maker to discuss operating activities, financial results, forecasts, or plans for the segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Connected Solutions Segment
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Connected Solutions designs
	and delivers performance critical antennas and site solutions for wireless networks globally.&nbsp;Our antennas and site solutions support networks worldwide, including SCADA for oil, gas and utilities, fleet management, industrial operations,
	health care, small cell and network timing deployment, defense, public safety, education, and broadband access. PCTEL&#146;s performance critical MAXRAD
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	and Bluewave&#153; antenna solutions
	include high rejection and high performance GPS and GNSS products, the industry leading Yagi antenna portfolio, mobile and indoor LTE, broadband, and LMR antennas and PIM-rated antennas for transit, in-building, and small cell applications. We
	provide design, logistics, and support capabilities to deliver performance critical site solutions into carrier, railroad, and utility applications. Revenue growth for antenna and site solutions is primarily driven by the increased use of wireless
	communications in these vertical markets. PCTEL&#146;s antenna and site solution products are primarily sold through distributors, value-added resellers, and original equipment manufacturers (&#147;OEM&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There are many competitors for antenna products, as the market is highly fragmented.&nbsp;Competitors include Laird (Cushcraft, Centurion, and Antennex
	brands), Mobile Mark, Radiall/Larsen, Comtelco, Wilson, Commscope (Andrew products), and Kathrein, among others.&nbsp;We seek out product applications that command a premium for product performance and customer service, and avoid commodity markets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D68635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	PCTEL maintains expertise in several technology areas in order to be competitive in the antenna engineered site
	solutions market.&nbsp;These include radio frequency engineering, mobile antenna design and manufacturing, mechanical engineering, product quality and testing, and wireless network engineering.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	RF Solutions Segment
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	RF Solutions develops and provides
	performance critical test equipment, software, and engineering services for wireless networks. The industry relies upon PCTEL to benchmark network performance, analyze trends, and optimize wireless networks. The Company&#146;s SeeGull
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;flex scanning receivers are used around the world for indoor and drive test applications, including baseline testing, acceptance testing, competitive benchmarking, spectrum clearing,
	troubleshooting, and network optimization. The SeeGull CW Transmitter supports the design, verification, and optimization of in-building networks. SeeHawk
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&nbsp;
</SUP>
	Analytics is a network analytics tool that translates data from multiple sources into actions that optimize network performance. PCTEL provides wireless network testing, commissioning,
	optimization, design, integration and consulting services for both indoor and outdoor networks.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Revenue growth for the segment&#146;s products and
	services is driven by the deployment of products based on new wireless technology and the need for wireless networks to be tuned and reconfigured on a regular basis. Our RF Solutions products are sold primarily through test and measurement
	value-added resellers and to a lesser extent directly to network operators.&nbsp;Competitors for these products are OEMs such as JDS Uniphase, Rohde and Schwarz, Anritsu, Digital Receiver Technology, and Berkley Varitronics. Our services are
	directly marketed to wireless carriers, network deployment companies, tower companies and industrial companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	PCTEL maintains expertise in several
	technology areas in order to be competitive in the scanning receiver and related engineering services market. These include radio frequency engineering, DSP engineering, manufacturing, mechanical engineering, product quality and testing, and
	wireless network engineering.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Major Customers
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There
	were no customers that accounted for 10% or greater of revenues or accounts receivable during the fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014, or 2013, respectively.
</P>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Total Domestic sales
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	See Note 12 of the consolidated financial statements for further geographical information.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Backlog
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Sales of our products are generally made
	pursuant to standard purchase orders, which are officially acknowledged according to standard terms and conditions.&nbsp;The backlog, while useful for scheduling production, is not a meaningful indicator of future revenues as the order to ship cycle
	is extremely short.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	4
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D68635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Research and Development
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We recognize that a strong technology base is essential to our long-term success and we have made a substantial investment in engineering and research and
	development.&nbsp;We will continue to devote substantial resources to product development and patent submissions.&nbsp;The patent submissions are primarily for defensive purposes, rather than for potential license revenue generation.&nbsp;We monitor
	changing customer needs and work closely with our customers, consultants and market research organizations to track changes in the marketplace, including emerging industry standards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Research and development expenses include costs for hardware and related software development, prototyping, certification and pre-production costs.&nbsp;We
	spent approximately $11.2 million, $11.7 million, and $11.1 million in the fiscal years 2015, 2014, and 2013, respectively, in research and development.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Sales, Marketing and Support
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We supply our products to
	public and private carriers, wireless infrastructure providers, wireless equipment distributors, value added resellers (&#147;VARs&#148;) and OEMs.&nbsp;PCTEL&#146;s direct sales force is technologically sophisticated and sales executives have
	strong industry domain knowledge. Our direct sales force supports the sales efforts of our distributors and OEM resellers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our marketing strategy is
	focused on building market awareness and acceptance of our new products.&nbsp;The marketing organization also provides a wide range of programs, materials and events to support the sales organization.&nbsp;We spent approximately $14.2 million, $13.0
	million, and $12.1 million in fiscal years 2015, 2014, and 2013, respectively, for sales and marketing support.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Manufacturing
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We do final assembly of most of our antenna products and all of our OEM receiver and interference management product lines.&nbsp;We also have arrangements with
	several contract manufacturers but are not dependent on any one.&nbsp;If any of our contract manufacturers are unable to provide satisfactory services for us, other contract manufacturers are available, although engaging a new contract manufacturer
	could cause unwanted delays and additional costs.&nbsp;We have no material guaranteed supply contracts or long-term agreements with any of our suppliers. We do have open purchase orders with our suppliers.&nbsp;See the contractual obligations and
	commercial commitments section of Item 7 for information on purchase commitments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Employees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had 491 full-time equivalent employees, consisting of 329 in operations, 61 in sales and marketing, 61 in research and
	development, and 40 in general and administrative functions.&nbsp;Total full-time equivalent employees were 465 and 449 at December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, respectively.&nbsp;Headcount increased by 26 at December&nbsp;31, 2015 from December&nbsp;31,
	2014 primarily due to the employees from our acquisition of the business of Nexgen Wireless, Inc.&nbsp;See additional information related to the acquisition of the business from Nexgen in Note 4 to the consolidated financial statements. None of our
	employees are represented by a labor union.&nbsp;We consider employee relations to be good.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Available Information
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our annual reports on Form 10-K, quarterly reports on Form 10-Q, current reports on Form 8-K, and amendments to such reports, are available free of charge
	through our website as soon as reasonably practicable after we electronically file such material with, or furnish it to, the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;). Our website is located at the following address:
<I>
	www.pctel.com.
</I>
	The information within, or that can be accessed through, our website, is not part of this Annual Report on Form 10-K. Further, any materials we file with the SEC may be read and copied by the public at the SEC&#146;s Public
	Reference Room, located at 100 F Street, N.E., Room 1580, Washington D.C. 20549. Information regarding the operation of the Public Reference Room can be obtained by calling the SEC at 1(800) SEC-0330. The SEC maintains an Internet site that contains
	reports, proxy and information statements and other information regarding our filings at www.
<I>
	sec.gov
</I>
	.
</P>
</EFX_BUSINESS>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<A NAME="D68635D10K_HTM_TOC68635_2">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;1A:
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Risk Factors
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Factors That May Affect Our Business, Financial Condition and Future Operations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Risks Related to Our Business
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Competition within the wireless product and services industry is intense and is expected to increase significantly.&nbsp;Failure to compete successfully
	could materially harm our prospects and financial results.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The market for our products and services is highly fragmented and is served by many local
	providers.&nbsp;We may not be able to displace established competitors from their customer base with our products and services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	5
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D68635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Many of our present and potential competitors have substantially greater financial, marketing, technical and
	other resources with which to pursue engineering, manufacturing, marketing, and distribution of their products and delivery of their services.&nbsp;These competitors may succeed in establishing technology standards or strategic alliances in the
	connectivity products markets, obtain more rapid market acceptance for their products, or otherwise gain a competitive advantage.&nbsp;We can offer no assurance that we will succeed in developing product technologies and services that are more
	effective than those developed by our competitors.&nbsp;We can offer no assurance that we will be able to compete successfully against existing and new competitors as the connectivity wireless markets evolve and the level of competition increases.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Our wireless business is dependent upon the continued growth and evolution of the wireless industry.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our future success is dependent upon the continued growth and evolution of the wireless industry.&nbsp;The growth in demand for wireless products and services
	may not continue at its current rate or at all.&nbsp;Any decrease in the growth of the wireless industry could have a material adverse effect on the results of our operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Our future success depends on our ability to develop and successfully introduce new and enhanced products for the wireless market that meet the needs of
	our customers.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our revenue depends on our ability to anticipate our existing and prospective customers&#146; needs and develop products and services
	that address those needs.&nbsp;Our future success will depend on our ability to introduce new products and services for the wireless market, anticipate improvements and enhancements in wireless technology and wireless standards, and to develop
	products and services that are competitive in the rapidly changing wireless industry.&nbsp;Introduction of new products,&nbsp;product enhancements, and services will require coordination of our efforts with those of our customers, suppliers, and
	manufacturers to rapidly achieve volume production.&nbsp;If we fail to coordinate these efforts, develop product enhancements or introduce new products that meet the needs of our customers as scheduled, our operating results will be materially and
	adversely affected and our business and prospects will be harmed.&nbsp;We cannot assure that product introductions will meet the anticipated release schedules or that our wireless products will be competitive in the market.&nbsp;Furthermore, given
	the evolving nature of the wireless market, there can be no assurance our products and technology will not be rendered obsolete by alternative or competing technologies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	We may experience integration or other problems with potential acquisitions, which could have an adverse effect on our business or results of
	operations.&nbsp;New acquisitions could dilute the interests of existing stockholders, and the announcement of new acquisitions could result in a decline in the price of our common stock.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We may in the future make acquisitions of, or large investments in, businesses that offer products, services, and technologies that we believe would
	complement our products or services, including wireless products and technology.&nbsp;We may also make acquisitions of or investments in, businesses that we believe could expand our distribution channels.&nbsp;Even if we were to announce an
	acquisition, we may not be able to complete it.&nbsp;Additionally, any future acquisition or substantial investment would present numerous risks, including:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	difficulty in integrating the technology, operations, internal accounting controls or work force of the acquired business with our existing business,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	disruption of our on-going business,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	difficulty in realizing the potential financial or strategic benefits of the transaction,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	difficulty in maintaining uniform standards, controls, procedures and policies,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	dealing with tax, employment, logistics, and other related issues unique to international organizations and assets we acquire,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	possible impairment of relationships with employees and customers as a result of integration of new businesses and management personnel, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	impairment of assets related to resulting goodwill, and reductions in our future operating results from amortization of intangible assets.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We expect that future acquisitions could provide for consideration to be paid in cash, shares of our common stock, or a combination of cash and our common
	stock.&nbsp;If consideration for a transaction is paid in common stock, this would further dilute our existing stockholders. We may also incur debt to pay for an acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	6
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D68635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Our gross profit may vary based on the mix of sales of our products and services, and these variations may
	cause our net income to decline.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Depending on the mix of our products and services sold, our gross profit could vary significantly from quarter to
	quarter.&nbsp;Generally, antenna products and engineering services have a lower profit margin than scanning receiver products creating the variance in gross profits related to profit mix.&nbsp;A variance or decrease of our gross profit could have a
	negative impact on our financial results and cause our net income to decline.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Any delays in our sales cycles could result in customers canceling
	purchases of our products.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Sales cycles for our products with major customers can be lengthy, often lasting nine months or longer.&nbsp;In addition,
	it can take an additional nine months or more before a customer commences volume production of equipment that incorporates our products.&nbsp;Sales cycles with our major customers are lengthy for a number of reasons, including:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	our OEM customers and carriers usually complete a lengthy technical evaluation of our products, over which we have no control, before placing a purchase order,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the development and commercial introduction of products incorporating new technologies frequently are delayed.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A significant portion of our operating expenses is relatively fixed and is largely based on our forecasts of volume and timing of orders.&nbsp;The lengthy
	sales cycles make forecasting the volume and timing of product orders difficult.&nbsp;In addition, the delays inherent in lengthy sales cycles raise additional risks of customer decisions to cancel or change product phases.&nbsp;If customer
	cancellations or product changes were to occur, this could result in the loss of anticipated sales without sufficient time for us to reduce our operating expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	We generally rely on independent companies to manufacture, assemble and test our products.&nbsp;If these companies do not meet their commitments to us, or
	if our own assembly operations are impaired, our ability to sell products to our customers would be impaired.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have limited manufacturing
	capability.&nbsp;For some product lines we outsource the manufacturing, assembly, and testing of printed circuit board subsystems.&nbsp;For other product lines, we purchase completed hardware platforms and add our proprietary software. While there
	is no unique capability with these suppliers, any failure by these suppliers to meet delivery commitments would cause us to delay shipments and potentially be unable to accept new orders for product.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, in the event that these suppliers discontinued the manufacture of materials used in our products, we would be forced to incur the time and
	expense of finding a new supplier or to modify our products in such a way that such materials were not necessary.&nbsp;Either of these alternatives could result in increased manufacturing costs and increased prices of our products.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We assemble our antenna products in our facilities located in Illinois and China and scanning receivers at our facility in Maryland.&nbsp;We may experience
	delays, disruptions, capacity constraints or quality control problems at our assembly facilities, which could result in lower yields or delays of product shipments to our customers.&nbsp;In addition, we are having a number of our antenna products
	manufactured in China via contract manufacturers.&nbsp;Any disruption of our own or contract manufacturers&#146; operations could cause us to delay product shipments, which would negatively impact our sales, competitive reputation and
	position.&nbsp;In addition, if we do not accurately forecast demand for our products, we will have excess or insufficient parts to build our products, either of which could materially affect our operating results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	In order for us to operate at a profitable level and continue to introduce and develop new products for emerging markets, we must attract and retain our
	executive officers and qualified engineering, technical, sales, support and other administrative personnel.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our performance is substantially
	dependent on the performance of our current executive officers and certain key engineering, sales, marketing, financial, technical and customer support personnel.&nbsp;If we lose the services of our executives or key employees, replacements could be
	difficult to recruit and, as a result, we may not be able to grow our business.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	7
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D68635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Competition for personnel, especially qualified engineering personnel, is intense.&nbsp;We are particularly
	dependent on our ability to identify, attract, motivate and retain qualified engineers with the requisite education, background and industry experience.&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we employed a total of 61 people in our research and
	development department.&nbsp;If we lose the services of one or more of our key engineering personnel, our ability to continue to develop products and technologies responsive to our markets may be impaired.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	We may be subject to litigation regarding intellectual property associated with our business and this could be costly to defend and could prevent us from
	using or selling the challenged technology.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In recent years, there has been significant litigation in the United States involving intellectual
	property rights.&nbsp;We expect potential claims in the future, including with respect to our wireless business.&nbsp;Intellectual property claims against us, and any resulting lawsuits, may result in significant expenses and could subject us to
	significant liability for damages and invalidate what we currently believe are our proprietary rights.&nbsp;These claims, regardless of their merits or outcome, would likely be time-consuming and expensive to resolve and could divert
	management&#146;s time and attention.&nbsp;This could have a material and adverse effect on our results of operations.&nbsp;Any intellectual property litigation disputes related to our&nbsp;business could also force us to do one or more of the
	following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	cease selling, incorporating or using technology, products or services that incorporate the disputed intellectual property,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	obtain from the holder of the disputed intellectual property a license to sell or use the relevant technology, which license may not be available on acceptable terms, if at all, or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	redesign those products or services that incorporate the disputed intellectual property, which could result in substantial unanticipated development expenses.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If we are subject to a successful claim of infringement related to our wireless intellectual property and we fail to develop non-infringing intellectual
	property or license the infringed intellectual property on acceptable terms and on a timely basis, operating results could decline, and our ability to grow and sustain our wireless business could be materially and adversely affected.&nbsp;As a
	result, our results of operations could be impaired.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We may in the future initiate claims or litigation against third parties for infringement of our
	intellectual property rights or to determine the scope and validity of our proprietary rights or the proprietary rights of our competitors.&nbsp;These claims could also result in significant expense and the diversion of technical and management
	personnel&#146;s attention.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Undetected failures found in new products may result in a loss of customers or a delay in market acceptance of our
	products.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To date, we have not been made aware of any significant failures in our products.&nbsp;However, despite testing by us and by current and
	potential customers, errors may be found in new products after commencement of commercial shipments, which could result in loss of revenue, loss of customers or delay in market acceptance, any of which could adversely affect our business, operating
	results, and financial condition.&nbsp;We cannot assure that our efforts to monitor, develop, modify and implement appropriate test and manufacturing processes for our products will be sufficient to avoid failures in our products that result in
	delays in product shipment, replacement costs or potential damage to our reputation, any of which could harm our business, operating results and financial condition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Conducting business in foreign countries involve additional risks.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A substantial portion of our manufacturing, research and development, and marketing activities is conducted outside the United States, including the United
	Kingdom, Hong Kong, and China.&nbsp;There are a number of risks inherent in doing business in foreign countries, including: unfavorable political or economic factors; unexpected legal or regulatory changes; lack of sufficient protection for
	intellectual property rights; difficulties in recruiting and retaining personnel and managing international operations; repatriation of earnings; and less developed infrastructure.&nbsp;If we are unable to manage successfully these and other risks
	pertaining to our international activities, our operating results, cash flows and financial position could be materially and adversely affected.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Our
	financial position and results of operations may be adversely affected if tax authorities challenge us and the tax challenges result in unfavorable outcomes.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We currently have international subsidiaries located in China, United Kingdom, and Israel as well as an international branch office located in Hong
	Kong.&nbsp;The complexities resulting from operating in several different tax jurisdictions increase our exposure to worldwide tax challenges.&nbsp;In the event a review of our tax filings results in unfavorable adjustments to our tax returns, our
	operating results, cash flows and financial position could be materially and adversely affected.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	8
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D68635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Conducting business in international markets involves foreign exchange rate exposure that may lead to reduced
	profitability.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We currently have operations in United Kingdom, Israel, Hong Kong, and China.&nbsp;Fluctuations in the value of the U.S. dollar
	relative to other currencies may impact our revenues, cost of revenues and operating margins and may result in foreign currency translation gains and losses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Risks Related to Our Industry
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Challenging
	economic conditions worldwide have from time to time contributed, and may continue to contribute, to slowdowns in the wireless industry at large, resulting in:
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	reduced demand for our products as a result of continued constraints on corporate and government spending by our customers,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	increased price competition for our products,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	risk of excess and obsolete inventory,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	risk of supply constraints,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	risk of excess facilities and manufacturing capacity, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	higher costs as a percentage of revenue and higher interest expense.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Our industry is characterized by
	rapidly changing technologies and rapidly changing competitive environments.&nbsp;If we are not successful in responding to these changes, our products may become obsolete and we may not be able to compete effectively.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We must continue to evaluate, develop and introduce technologically advanced products that will position us for possible growth in the wireless
	market.&nbsp;If we are not successful in doing so, our products may not be accepted in the market or may become obsolete and we may not be able to compete effectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Consolidation and vertical integration in our industry, and particularly integration of our customers with our competitors, may significantly reduce our
	ability to successfully market our products to long-standing customers and may adversely affect our vertically integrated customers&#146; ability to choose our products even if our products are technologically superior.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Changes in laws or regulations, in particular future Federal Communications Commission (&#147;FCC&#148;) regulations or international regulations affecting
	the broadband market, internet service providers, or the communications industry, could negatively affect our ability to develop new technologies or sell new products and, therefore, reduce our profitability.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The jurisdiction of the FCC extends to the entire communications industry, including our customers and their products and services that incorporate our
	products.&nbsp;Future FCC regulations affecting the broadband access services industry, our customers or our products may harm our business.&nbsp;For example, future FCC regulatory policies that affect the availability of data and Internet services
	may impede our customers&#146; penetration into their markets or affect the prices that they are able to charge.&nbsp;In addition, FCC regulatory policies that affect the specifications of wireless data devices may impede certain of our
	customers&#146; ability to manufacture their products profitably, which could, in turn, reduce demand for our products.&nbsp;Furthermore, international regulatory bodies are beginning to adopt standards for the communications industry.&nbsp;Although
	our business has not been hurt by any regulations to date, in the future, delays caused by our compliance with regulatory requirements may result in order cancellations or postponements of product purchases by our customers, which would reduce our
	profitability.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Risks Related to our Common Stock
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	The trading price of our stock price may be volatile based on a number of factors, many of which are not under our control.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our stock can experience significant changes in price on a percentage basis. The common stock price fluctuated between a high of $8.88 and a low of $4.38 in
	2015.&nbsp;Our stock price could be subject to wide fluctuations in response to a variety of factors, many of which are out of our control, including:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	adverse change in domestic or global economic conditions,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	9
</P>

</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

	changes in financial estimates by securities analysts,
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	announcements of technological innovations,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	our announcement of significant acquisitions, strategic partnerships, joint ventures or capital commitments,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="5%">

</TD>

</TD>

</TD>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	additions or departures of key personnel,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	mergers and acquisitions, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	sales of common stock by our stockholders or us or repurchases by us.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, the NASDAQ Global Select
	Market, where many publicly held telecommunications companies, including PCTEL, are traded, often experiences extreme price and volume fluctuations.&nbsp;These fluctuations often have been unrelated or disproportionate to the operating performance
	of these companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Provisions in our charter documents may inhibit a change of control or a change of management, which may cause the market price for
	our common stock to decline and may inhibit a takeover or change in our control that a stockholder may consider favorable.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Provisions in our charter
	documents could discourage potential acquisition proposals and could delay or prevent a change in control transaction that our stockholders may favor.&nbsp;Specifically, our charter documents do not permit stockholders to act by written consent, do
	not permit stockholders to call a stockholders meeting, and provide for a classified board of directors, which means stockholders can only elect, or remove, a limited number of our directors in any given year.&nbsp;These provisions could have the
	effect of discouraging others from making tender offers for our shares, and as a result, these provisions may prevent the market price of our common stock from reflecting the effects of actual or rumored takeover attempts and may prevent
	stockholders from reselling their shares at or above the price at which they purchased their shares.&nbsp;These provisions may also prevent changes in our management that our stockholders may favor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our board of directors has the authority to issue up to 5,000,000 shares of preferred stock in one or more series.&nbsp;The board of directors can fix the
	price, rights, preferences, privileges and restrictions of this preferred stock without any further vote or action by our stockholders.&nbsp;The rights of the holders of our common stock will be affected by, and may be adversely affected by, the
	rights of the holders of any preferred stock that may be issued in the future.&nbsp;Further, the issuance of shares of preferred stock may delay or prevent a change in control transaction without further action by our stockholders.&nbsp;As a result,
	the market price of our common stock may decline.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	If we are unable to successfully maintain processes and procedures required by the Sarbanes-Oxley
	Act of 2002 to achieve and maintain effective internal control over our financial reporting, our ability to provide reliable and timely financial reports could be harmed and our stock price could be adversely affected.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We must comply with the rules promulgated under Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002.&nbsp;Section 404 requires an annual management report assessing
	the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting and a report by our independent registered public accounting firm addressing this assessment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	While we are expending significant resources in maintaining the necessary documentation and testing procedures required by Section&nbsp;404, we cannot be
	certain that the actions we are taking to achieve and maintain our internal control over financial reporting will be adequate.&nbsp;If the processes and procedures that we implement for our internal control over financial reporting are inadequate,
	our ability to provide reliable and timely financial reports, and consequently our business and operating results, could be harmed.&nbsp;This in turn could result in an adverse reaction in the financial markets due to a loss of confidence in the
	reliability of our financial reports, which could cause the market price of our common stock to decline.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	10
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Facility Changes
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Pursuant to the Asset Purchase Agreement dated February&nbsp;27, 2015 with Nexgen, we assumed the lease for office space in Schaumburg, Illinois consisting of
	6,652 square feet.&nbsp;The total lease obligation pursuant to this lease assumption was $0.3 million. The Schaumburg lease expires on October&nbsp;31, 2018, but contains a one-time option to elect an early termination of the lease on
	August&nbsp;31, 2016.&nbsp;In March&nbsp;2016, we exercised the early termination option and paid a fee of $57.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In April&nbsp;2015, we terminated the
	lease related to a sales office in San Antonio, Texas effective September&nbsp;27, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In May&nbsp;2015, we entered into a new five-year, five-month
	office lease in Englewood, Colorado consisting of 4,579 square feet of leased space for our expanding engineering services business.&nbsp;The total lease obligation pursuant to this lease is $0.6 million.&nbsp;The lease expires on February&nbsp;28,
	2021; however, during the first quarter 2016, the Company vacated this facility and is marketing this property for sublease. The office is located in an area with low vacancy rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Effective October&nbsp;31, 2015, our lease for our mobile tower assembly facility in Pryor, Oklahoma expired in accordance with its terms.&nbsp;This lease was
	not renewed after October&nbsp;2015 because of the Company&#146;s exit from the mobile tower product line.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Due to the recent transfer of certain
	manufacturing activities to our Tianjin, China facility, in October&nbsp;2015 we entered into a new five-year lease for additional manufacturing space in Tianjin consisting of 22,163 square feet which expands our footprint in Tianjin to 44,289
	square feet. This lease expires October&nbsp;2020.&nbsp;The total lease obligation pursuant to this lease is $0.2 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All properties are in good
	condition and are suitable for the purposes for which they are used.&nbsp;We believe that we have adequate space for our current needs.
</P>
</EFX_PROPERTIES>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<A NAME="D68635D10K_HTM_TOC68635_5">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;3:
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Legal Proceedings
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TelWorx Parties
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	After discovering accounting irregularities with respect to the TelWorx Entities and conducting an internal investigation, we pursued restitution from the
	TelWorx Parties.&nbsp;See Note 8 of the consolidated financial statements for a description of the TelWorx Parties.&nbsp;A legal settlement with an aggregate fair value of $5.4 million was reached with the TelWorx Parties in March&nbsp;2013 as
	further described therein.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	11
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D68635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Other parties on the TelWorx acquisition&nbsp;
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We also engaged in efforts to seek restitution from two other parties used by the TelWorx Parties for professional services in the sale of the business to
	PCTEL. On September&nbsp;30, 2014, we settled in cash with one party for $0.1 million and on October&nbsp;10, 2014, we settled with the other party in cash for $0.8 million.
</P>
</EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The closing sale price of our common stock as reported on the NASDAQ Global Select Market on March&nbsp;10, 2016 was $5.30 per
	share. As of that date there were 35 holders of record of the common stock. A substantially greater number of holders of the common stock are in &#147;street name&#148; or beneficial holders, whose shares are held of record by banks, brokers, and
	other financial institutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Five-Year Cumulative Total Return Comparison
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following graph compares the annual percentage change in the cumulative return to our stockholders with the cumulative return of the NASDAQ Composite Index
	and the S&amp;P Information Technology Index for the period beginning December&nbsp;31, 2010 and ending December&nbsp;31, 2015.&nbsp;Returns for the indices are weighted based on market capitalization at the beginning of each measurement
	point.&nbsp;Note that historic stock price performance is not necessarily indicative of future stock price performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/15/0001193125-16-505058_G68635TX_PG11.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Sales of Unregistered Equity Securities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	None.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All share repurchase programs are authorized by our Board of Directors and are announced publicly.&nbsp;On April&nbsp;20, 2015, our Board of Directors
	authorized an additional 500,000 shares of stock for our share repurchase program.&nbsp;Additionally, on August&nbsp;10, 2015, our Board of Directors authorized an additional 1,300,000 shares under the existing share repurchase programs, for a total
	of 2,726,000 shares.&nbsp;We repurchased 1,942,788 shares at an average price of $6.22 during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.&nbsp;At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had 783,212 shares authorized for repurchase under this program.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	in this Annual Report on Form 10-K.&nbsp;The statement of operations data for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2012 and 2011 and the balance sheet data as of December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2012, and 2011 are derived from audited financial statements not

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">

	Table of Contents

</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<A NAME="D68635D10K_HTM_TOC68635_9">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;7:
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	following commentary presents a discussion and analysis of the Company&#146;s financial condition and results of operations by its management. The review highlights the principal factors affecting earnings and the significant changes in balance
	sheet items for the years 2015 and 2014. Financial information for prior years is presented when appropriate. The objective of this financial review is to enhance investor understanding of the accompanying tables and charts, the consolidated
	financial statements, notes to financial statements, and financial statistics appearing elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form 10-K. Where applicable, this discussion also reflects management&#146;s insights with respect to known events and trends
	that have or may reasonably be expected to have a material effect on the Company&#146;s operations and financial condition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our 2015 revenues decreased
	by $0.5 million (0.5%), compared to 2014, due to lower revenues from scanning receivers and engineered site solutions, offset by revenue generated from the business acquired from Nexgen. We recorded an operating loss of $5.8 million in 2015,
	compared to an operating profit of $4.1 million in 2014.&nbsp;The loss was the result of product mix with lower gross margins, higher intangible amortization, sales and marketing expenses, and restructuring expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Introduction
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	PCTEL delivers
<B>
	P
</B>
	erformance
<B>
	C
</B>
	ritical
<B>
	Tel
</B>
	ecom solutions. RF Solutions develops and provides test equipment, software and engineering services for wireless networks. The industry relies upon PCTEL to benchmark network performance, analyze trends, and optimize
	wireless networks. Connected Solutions designs and delivers performance critical antennas and site solutions for wireless networks globally. Our antennas support evolving wireless standards for cellular, private, and broadband networks. PCTEL
	antennas and site solutions support networks worldwide, including SCADA for oil, gas and utilities, fleet management, industrial operations, health care, small cell and network timing deployment, defense, public safety, education, and broadband
	access.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Revenue growth for antenna products and site solutions is driven by emerging wireless applications in the following markets: public safety,
	military, and government applications; SCADA, health care, energy, smart grid and agricultural applications; indoor wireless, wireless backhaul, and cellular applications. Revenue growth for scanning receiver products, interference management
	products, and optimization services is driven by the deployment of new wireless technology and the need for wireless networks to be tuned and reconfigured on a regular basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have an intellectual property portfolio related to antennas, the mounting of antennas, and scanning receivers. These patents are being held for defensive
	purposes and are not part of an active licensing program.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We operate in two segments for reporting purposes. Our Connected Solutions segment includes our
	antenna and engineered site solutions and our RF Solutions segment includes our scanning receivers and related RF engineering services. Each segment has its own segment manager as well as its own engineering, sales and marketing, and operational
	general and administrative functions. All of our accounting and finance, human resources, IT and legal functions are provided on a centralized basis through the corporate function.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On February&nbsp;27, 2015, PCTEL acquired substantially all of the assets of, and assumed certain specified liabilities of, Nexgen Wireless, Inc.
	(&#147;Nexgen&#148;) pursuant to an Asset Purchase Agreement dated as of February&nbsp;27, 2015&nbsp;(the &#147;Nexgen APA&#148;).&nbsp;The business acquired from Nexgen is based in Schaumburg, Illinois.&nbsp;Nexgen provided a network analysis tool
	portfolio now known as SeeHawk
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&nbsp;
</SUP>
	Analytics, and engineering services.&nbsp;The RF engineering services acquired in 2015 were integrated
	into the existing RF engineering services operation and the data analytics products were integrated in the RF scanner product line.&nbsp;Nexgen&#146;s software product portfolio translates real-time network performance data into engineering actions
	to optimize operator performance and supports crowd-based, cloud-based data analysis to enhance network performance. Nexgen provides performance engineering, specialized staffing, and trend analysis for carriers, infrastructure vendors, and neutral
	hosts for 2G, 3G, 4G, and LTE networks. Refer to Note 4 of the financial statements for more information on the Nexgen acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On April&nbsp;30,
	2013, we divested all material assets associated with PCTEL Secure&#146;s ProsettaCore&#153; technology to Redwall Technologies, LLC (&#147;Redwall&#148;), a development organization that specializes in mobile security, military and defense projects
	and systems, and critical national infrastructure. Under the terms of the agreement, Redwall acquired the server and device software (the &#147;Software&#148;), the underlying IP, and complete development responsibility for the security products. At
	the closing of the divestiture, we received no upfront cash payment, but have the right to receive a royalty of 7% of the net sale price of each future sale or license of the Software and each provision of services related to the Software, if any.
	Under the agreement, royalties will not exceed $10.0 million in the aggregate. In accordance with accounting for discontinued operations, the consolidated financial statements separately reflect the results of PCTEL Secure as discontinued operations
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	16
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage17"></A>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Revenues were approximately $106.6 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, a decrease of 0.5% from the prior
	year.&nbsp;Revenues for the RF Solutions segment increased by $2.1 million (6.1%) due to revenue generated from the business acquired from Nexgen, offset by lower revenues for scanning receivers.&nbsp;Revenues for the Connected Solutions segment
	decreased $2.8 million (3.8%).&nbsp;Within Connected Solutions, revenues increased for antenna products, but decreased for cellular kitting products and mobile towers.&nbsp;We exited the mobile tower product line as of September&nbsp;30,
	2015.&nbsp;The decline in revenues from mobile towers contributed 2.6% of the 3.8% decrease in revenues for Connected Solutions for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to the prior year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Revenues were approximately $107.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, an increase of 2.8% from the prior year.&nbsp;RF Solutions segment
	revenue increased $4.8 million (15.8%) due to the rapid growth of in-building wireless network expansion. Connected Solutions segment revenue decreased $1.9 million, or 2.5%.&nbsp;Within the Connected Solutions segment, revenue declined for antenna
	products, but increased for cellular kitting products.
</P>
